elements.description:
`xhr-simple-request`
A XHR request that works with API components.

This is a copy of `iron-request` element from PolymerElements library but
adjusted to work with `API request` object (or ARC request object).

It also handles custom events related to request flow.

properties.name: isPayload
properties.description:
Set to true when the request can carry a payload.
It's required for calculating headers errors.

properties.name: succeeded
properties.description:
Succeeded is true if the request succeeded. The request succeeded if it
loaded without error, wasn't aborted, and the status code is â‰¥ 200, and
< 300, or if the status code is 0.

The status code 0 is accepted as a success because some schemes - e.g.
file:// - don't provide status codes.

properties.name: xhr
properties.description:
A reference to the XMLHttpRequest instance used to generate the
network request.

properties.name: response
properties.description:
A reference to the parsed response body, if the `xhr` has completely
resolved.

properties.name: headers
properties.description:
A reference to response headers, if the `xhr` has completely
resolved.

properties.name: status
properties.description: A reference to the status code, if the `xhr` has completely resolved.

properties.name: statusText
properties.description: A reference to the status text, if the `xhr` has completely resolved.

properties.name: completes
properties.description:
A promise that resolves when the `xhr` response comes back, or rejects
if there is an error before the `xhr` completes.
The resolve callback is called with the original request as an argument.
By default, the reject callback is called with an `Error` as an argument.
If `rejectWithRequest` is true, the reject callback is called with an
object with two keys: `request`, the original request, and `error`, the
error object.

properties.name: progress
properties.description:
An object that contains progress information emitted by the XHR if
available.

properties.name: aborted
properties.description: Aborted will be true if an abort of the request is attempted.

properties.name: errored
properties.description:
Errored will be true if the browser fired an error event from the
XHR object (mainly network errors).

properties.name: timedOut
properties.description: TimedOut will be true if the XHR threw a timeout event.

properties.name: appendHeaders
properties.description:
Appends headers to each request handled by this component.

Example

```html
<xhr-simple-request
 append-headers="x-token: 123\nx-api-demo: true"></xhr-simple-request>
```

properties.name: _addHeaders
properties.description: Computed list of headers to add to each request.

properties.name: proxy
properties.description:
If set every request made from the console will be proxied by the service provided in this
value.
It will prefix entered URL with the proxy value. so the call to
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/path/http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value`

If the proxy require a to pass the URL as a query parameter define value as follows:
`https://proxy.com/path/?url=`. In this case be sure to set `proxy-encode-url`
attribute.

properties.name: proxyEncodeUrl
properties.description:
If `proxy` is set, it will URL encode the request URL before appending it to the proxy URL.
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdomain.com%2Fpath%2F%3Fquery%3Dsome%2Bvalue`

methods.name: filterHeaders
methods.description:
Filter array of headers and return not duplicated array of the same headers.
Duplicated headers should be appended to already found one using coma separator.

params.name: headers
params.description:
Headers array to filter. All objects in headers array must have "name"
               and "value" keys.

methods.name: headersToString
methods.description: Parse headers array to Raw HTTP headers string.

params.name: headersArray
params.description:
List of objects with "name" and "value"
properties.

return.desc: A HTTP representation of the headers.

methods.name: headerItemToString
methods.description:
Transforms a header model item to a string.
Array values are supported.

methods.name: headersToJSON
methods.description:
Parse HTTP headers input from string to array of objects containing `name` and `value`
properties.

params.name: headers
params.description: Raw HTTP headers input or Headers object

return.desc:
The array of objects where properties are `name` as a header
name and `value` as a header content.

methods.name: _headersStringToJSON
methods.description:
Parse headers string to array of objects.
See `#toJSON` for more info.

methods.name: _hedersToJSON
methods.description:
Parse Headers object to array of objects.
See `#toJSON` for more info.

methods.name: _oldCombine
methods.description:
Helper method for old system: combine headers list with encoding value.
Note that this function will update the original array.

params.name: encoding
params.description: An encoding string from the old request.

return.desc: True if encoding has been added to the array.

methods.name: getContentType
methods.description: Get the Content-Type value from the headers.

params.name: headers
params.description: Either HTTP headers string or list of headers.

return.desc: A content-type header value or null if not found

methods.name: replaceHeaderValue
methods.description: Replace value for given header in the headers list.

params.name: headers
params.description:
A headers object. Can be string, array of objects or
Headers object.

methods.name: getHeaderError
methods.description: Get error message for given header string.

return.desc: An error message or null if the headers are valid.

methods.name: send
methods.description: Sends a request.

params.name: options
params.description:
API request object
- url `String` The url to which the request is sent.
- method `(string|undefined)` The HTTP method to use, default is GET.
- payload `(ArrayBuffer|ArrayBufferView|Blob|Document|FormData|null|string|undefined|Object)`
The content for the request body for POST method.
- headers `String` HTTP request headers.
- withCredentials `(boolean|undefined)` Whether or not to send credentials on the request. Default is false.
- timeout `(Number|undefined)` Timeout for request, in milliseconds.
- id `String` Request ID

methods.name: _applyHeaders
methods.description: Applies headers to the XHR object.

methods.name: _progressHandler
methods.description:
Handler for the XHR `progress` event.
It sets `progress` property and dispatches `api-request-progress-changed`
custom event.

methods.name: _errorHandler
methods.description: Handler for XHR `error` event.

methods.name: _timeoutHandler
methods.description: Handler for XHR `timeout` event.

methods.name: _abortHandler
methods.description: Handler for XHR `abort` event.

methods.name: _loadEndHandler
methods.description: Handler for XHR `loadend` event.

methods.name: abort
methods.description: Aborts the request.

methods.name: _updateStatus
methods.description: Updates the status code and status text.

methods.name: parseResponse
methods.description:
Attempts to parse the response body of the XHR. If parsing succeeds,
the value returned will be deserialized based on the `responseType`
set on the XHR.

TODO: The `responseType` will always be empty string because
send function does not sets the response type.
API request object does not support this property. However in the future
it may actually send this information extracted from the AMF model.
This function will be ready to handle this case.

return.desc:
The parsed response,
or undefined if there was an empty response or parsing failed.

methods.name: collectHeaders
methods.description: Collects response headers string from the XHR object.

methods.name: _computeAddHeaders
methods.description:
Computes value for `_addHeaders` property.
A list of headers to add to each request.

methods.name: _appendProxy
methods.description: Sets the proxy URL if the `proxy` property is set.

params.name: url
params.description: Request URL to alter if needed.

return.desc: The URL to use with request.

elements.name: TransportElements.XhrSimpleRequestTransport

attributes.name: is-payload
attributes.description:
Set to true when the request can carry a payload.
It's required for calculating headers errors.

attributes.name: status

attributes.name: status-text
attributes.description: A reference to the status text, if the `xhr` has completely resolved.

A promise that resolves when the `xhr` response comes back, or rejects
if there is an error before the `xhr` completes.
The resolve callback is called with the original request as an argument.

Appends headers to each request handled by this component.

Example

 append-headers="x-token: 123\nx-api-demo: true"></xhr-simple-request>

attributes.name: proxy
attributes.description:
If set every request made from the console will be proxied by the service provided in this
value.
It will prefix entered URL with the proxy value. so the call to
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/path/http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value`

If the proxy require a to pass the URL as a query parameter define value as follows:
`https://proxy.com/path/?url=`. In this case be sure to set `proxy-encode-url`
attribute.

attributes.description:
If `proxy` is set, it will URL encode the request URL before appending it to the proxy URL.
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdomain.com%2Fpath%2F%3Fquery%3Dsome%2Bvalue`

events.name: api-request-progress-changed
events.description:
api-request-progress-changed

Dispatched with XHR progress event

elements.description:
`xhr-simple-request`
A XHR request that works with API components.

It handles `api-request` and `abort-api-request` custom events that control
request flow in API components ecosystem.

This makes a request by using `XMLHttpRequest` object.

## ARC request data model

The `api-request` custom event has to contain ARC (Advanced REST client)
request data model. It expects the following properties:
- url (`String`) - Request URL
- method (`String`) - Request HTTP method.
- headers (`String|undefined`) - HTTP headers string
- payload (`String|FormData|File|ArrayBuffer|undefined`) Request body
- id (`String`) **required**, request id. It can be any string, it must be unique.

Note, this library does not validates the values and use them as is.
Any error related to validation has to be handled by the application.

## api-response data model

When response is ready the element dispatches `api-response` custom event
with following properties in the detail object.
- id (`String`) - Request incomming ID
- request (`Object`) - Original request object from `api-request` event
- loadingTime (`Number`) - High precise timing used by the performance API
- isError (`Boolean`) - Indicates if the request is errored
- error (`Error|undefined`) - Error object
- response (`Object`) - The response data:
 - status (`Number`) - Response status code
 - statusText (`String`) - Response status text. Can be empty string.
 - payload (`String|Document|ArrayBuffer|Blob`) - Response body
 - headers (`String|undefined`) - Response headers

Please note that aborting the request always sends `api-response` event
with `isError` set to true.

properties.name: eventsTarget
properties.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

properties.name: _oldEventsTarget
properties.description: An event target used to attach listeners.

properties.name: activeRequests
properties.description:
Map of active request objects.
Keys in the map is request ID and vaue is instance of
`XhrSimpleRequestTransport`

properties.name: loading
properties.description: True while loading latest started requests.

properties.name: lastRequest
properties.description: Latest used request object.

properties.name: appendHeaders
properties.description:
Appends headers to each request handled by this component.

Example

```html
<xhr-simple-request
 append-headers="x-token: 123\nx-api-demo: true"></xhr-simple-request>
```

properties.name: proxy
properties.description:
If set every request made from the console will be proxied by the service provided in this
value.
It will prefix entered URL with the proxy value. so the call to
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/path/http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value`

If the proxy require a to pass the URL as a query parameter define value as follows:
`https://proxy.com/path/?url=`. In this case be sure to set `proxy-encode-url`
attribute.

properties.name: proxyEncodeUrl
properties.description:
If `proxy` is set, it will URL encode the request URL before appending it to the proxy URL.
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdomain.com%2Fpath%2F%3Fquery%3Dsome%2Bvalue`

methods.name: _eventsTargetChanged
methods.description:
Removes old handlers (if any) and attaches listeners on new event
event target.

params.name: eventsTarget
params.description:
Event target to set handlers on. If not set it
will set handlers on the `window` object.

methods.name: _createRequest
methods.description: Creates instance of transport object with current configuration.

methods.name: _requestHandler
methods.description: Handles for the `api-request` custom event. Transports the request.

methods.name: _aborthHandler
methods.description:
Handler for `abort-api-request` event. Aborts the request and reports
errored response.
It expects the event to have `id` property set on the detail object.

methods.name: _createDetail
methods.description: Creates a detail object for `api-response` cutom event

methods.name: _responseHandler
methods.description: Handles response from the transport.

methods.name: _erroreHandler
methods.description: Handles transport error

methods.name: _notifyResponse
methods.description: Dispatches `api-response` custom event.

methods.name: _discardRequest
methods.description: Removes request from active requests.

elements.name: TransportElements.XhrSimpleRequest

attributes.name: events-target
attributes.description:
Events handlers target. By default the element listens on
`window` object. If set, all events listeners will be attached to this
object instead of `window`.

attributes.name: active-requests
attributes.description:
Map of active request objects.
Keys in the map is request ID and vaue is instance of
`XhrSimpleRequestTransport`

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: True while loading latest started requests.

attributes.name: last-request
attributes.description: Latest used request object.

attributes.name: append-headers
attributes.description:
Appends headers to each request handled by this component.

Example

```html
<xhr-simple-request
 append-headers="x-token: 123\nx-api-demo: true"></xhr-simple-request>
```

attributes.name: proxy
attributes.description:
If set every request made from the console will be proxied by the service provided in this
value.
It will prefix entered URL with the proxy value. so the call to
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/path/http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value`

If the proxy require a to pass the URL as a query parameter define value as follows:
`https://proxy.com/path/?url=`. In this case be sure to set `proxy-encode-url`

attributes.name: proxy-encode-url
attributes.description:
If `proxy` is set, it will URL encode the request URL before appending it to the proxy URL.
`http://domain.com/path/?query=some+value` will become
`https://proxy.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fdomain.com%2Fpath%2F%3Fquery%3Dsome%2Bvalue`

events.name: api-response
events.description:
api-response

Dispatched when the response is ready.

For list of parameters see element's documentation.
